chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b_nat: nat
Hb_nat: 2 <= b_nat

Goal:
alpha_nat 1 = 1

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
alpha_nat = fix alpha_nat (n : nat) : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | 1 => 1 | S (S r as p) => b_nat * alpha_nat p - alpha_nat r end : nat -> nat Arguments alpha_nat _%nat_scope
VectorDef.take : forall p : nat, p <= ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A p where ?A : [b_nat : nat Hb_nat : 2 <= b_nat |- Type] ?n : [b_nat : nat Hb_nat : 2 <= b_nat |- nat]
alpha_nat_fix_0 = eq_refl : alpha_nat 0 = 0
Nat.log2_up_spec : forall a : nat, 1 < a -> 2 ^ Nat.pred (Nat.log2_up a) < a <= 2 ^ Nat.log2_up a
power_ge_n : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> k <= mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 k p
power_sinc : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 k p < mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 (S k) p
power_smono_l : forall p q x : nat, 2 <= x -> p < q -> mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 p x < mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 q x
divides_2_inv : forall p : nat, p │ 2 -> p = 1 \/ p = 2
Nat.lt_1_2 = (fun lemma : 2 = 2 => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.lt_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation))) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive 1) 2 2 lemma) Nat.two_succ (Nat.lt_succ_diag_r 1) : 1 < 2
Wilson_theorem : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> prime p < -> p │ fact (p - 1) + 1
euclid_2 : forall n : nat, exists q : nat, n = 2 * q \/ n = 1 + 2 * q
power_mono : forall p q x : nat, 1 <= x -> p <= q -> mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 p x <= mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 q x
power_mono_l : forall p q x : nat, 1 <= x -> p <= q -> mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 p x <= mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 q x
prime_or_div : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> {q : nat | 2 <= q < p /\ q │ p} + {prime p}
Nat.log2_unique : forall a b : nat, 0 <= b -> 2 ^ b <= a < 2 ^ S b -> Nat.log2 a = b
binomial_n1 : forall n : nat, 1 <= n -> binomial n 1 = n
Nat.log2_spec : forall n : nat, 0 < n -> 2 ^ Nat.log2 n <= n < 2 ^ S (Nat.log2 n)
prime_algo : forall p : nat, prime p < -> p = 2 \/ 3 <= p /\ ~ 2 │ p /\ (forall n : nat, 3 + 2 * n < p -> ~ 3 + 2 * n │ p)
Nat.log2_unique' : forall a b c : nat, 0 <= b -> 0 <= c < 2 ^ b -> a = 2 ^ b + c -> Nat.log2 a = b
Nat.log2_iter_spec : forall k p q r : nat, 2 ^ S p = q + S r -> r < 2 ^ p -> let s := Nat.log2_iter k p q r in 2 ^ s <= k + q < 2 ^ S s
power_ge_1 : forall k p : nat, p <> 0 -> 1 <= mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 k p
Nat.log2_up_unique : forall a b : nat, 0 < b -> 2 ^ Nat.pred b < a <= 2 ^ b -> Nat.log2_up a = b
Nat.two_succ = eq_refl : 2 = 2
prime_bool_rec_spec : forall n p : nat, n <= p -> prime_bool_rec n p = true < -> (forall k : nat, 3 <= n - 2 * k -> ~ n - 2 * k │ p)
base_p : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> nat -> list nat
divides_fact_lt : forall q n : nat, 1 <= q <= n -> q │ fact n
Nat.log2_up_eqn0 : forall a : nat, a <= 1 -> Nat.log2_up a = 0
divides_not_0_interval : forall p q : nat, q <> 0 -> p │ q -> 1 <= p <= q
Nat.one_succ = eq_refl : 1 = 1
Nat.lt_0_1 = (fun lemma : 1 = 1 => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.lt_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation))) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive 0) 1 1 lemma) Nat.one_succ (Nat.lt_succ_diag_r 0) : 0 < 1
div_by_p_lt : forall p n : nat, 2 <= p -> n <> 0 -> div n p < n
prime_factor : forall n : nat, 2 <= n -> {p : nat | prime p /\ p │ n}
prime_2 = conj ((fun lemma : 2 <> 1 <-> 2%Z <> 1%Z => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (2 <> 1) (2%Z <> 1%Z) lemma) (ZifyClasses.not_morph (2 = 1) (2%Z = 1%Z) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) 2 2%Z eq_refl 1 1%Z eq_refl)) (let __arith : 2%Z = 1%Z -> False := let __wit := nil in let __varmap := VarMap.Empty in let __ff := Tauto.N (Tauto.A {| RingMicromega.Flhs := EnvRing.PEc 2%Z; RingMicromega.Fop := RingMicromega.OpEq; RingMicromega.Frhs := EnvRing.PEc 1%Z |} tt) in ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker_sound __ff __wit (eq_refl <: ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker __ff __...
base_p_spec : forall (p : nat) (Hp : 2 <= p) (n : nat), n = expand p (base_p Hp n)
div_ge_1 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall n : nat, p <= n -> 1 <= div n p
msum_first_two : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), 2 <= n -> (forall i : nat, 2 <= i -> f i = u) -> msum m u n f = m (f 0) (f 1)
power_0 : forall x : nat, mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 0 x = 1
divides_1_inv : forall p : nat, p │ 1 -> p = 1
power_S : forall n x : nat, mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 (S n) x = x * mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 n x
fact_0 = eq_refl : fact 0 = 1
Nat.mul_1_l : forall n : nat, 1 * n = n
